title.narrative: AECF 2017-22 Renewable Energy and Adaptation to Climate Technologies (REACT)
AECF 2017-22 Renewable Energy and Adaptation to Climate Technologies (REACT)

description.narrative:
Insatsen består av ett stöd till en Challenge Fund; REACT (Renewable Energy, Adaptation and Climate Technology). REACT administreras av Africa Enterprise Challenge Fund Ldt (AECF), med Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa (AGRA) som enda ägare/medlem. AECF är ett icke-vinstdrivande företag och AGRA är en "non profit organization registered in Washington State as a public charity”. AECF är registrerat på Mauritus som bedömts som det afrikanska land som har den mest lämpliga företagslagstiftningen för att kunna bedriva AECF's verksamhet. För att få bedriva verksamhet utanför Mauritius finns bara alternativet "Global Business Licence" enligt gällande lagstiftning.
Insatsen omfattar sju av Sveriges samarbetsländer samt den regionala strategin för Afrika söder om Sahara.
Syftet med REACT är att stimulera små och medelstora företag, att utveckla affärsmodeller, service och produkter inom förnybar energi som förbättrar livet för fattiga. REACT bygger på att företagen med stöd från REACT är beredda att ta risker de annars inte skulle göra. Företagen identifieras via tävlingar i de respektive länderna, där ansökningar bedöms utifrån tydliga och transparenta kriterier. Urvalet görs i tre steg, och med hjälp av olika aktörer för varje steg. Detta för att säkerställa en oberoende och öppen process. I stödet ingår även insatser för kapacitetsutveckling av förtagen inom en rad olika områden, märklarservice för framgångsrika företag att få tillgång till kapital för att utöka sin verksamhet, lärande och påverkansarbete i nationella och regionala frågor (lagar, handelshinder etc.). Totalt ska cirka 324 000 hushåll få förbättrad tillgång till förnybar energi samtidigt som cirka 200 000 ton CO2 utsläpp undviks.
Insatsbeslutet är femårigt och uppgår totalt till 400 MSEK. Av beloppet avsätts 2 MSEK inom den regionala strategin för extern uppföljning och bedömning av resultat samt för att bidra till lärande mellan olika länder.

The contribution consists of support to a Challenge Fund; REACT (Renewable Energy, Adaptation and Climate Change Technology). REACT - sub-Saharan Africa, is administered by Afica Enterprise Challenge Fund Ltd (AECF), a non-profit company with AGRA (African Green Revolution) as the sole owner/member. AGRA is a "“non profit organization registered in Washington State as a public charity”. The contribution includes components in seven of Sweden's cooperation countries and the regional strategy for sub-Saharan Africa.
The objective of REACT is to stimulate small and medium-sized companies, to develop business models, services and products in renewable energy and energy efficiency that improve the lives of the poor. The idea is that companies supported by REACT are prepared to take risks, which they otherwise would not take. The ideas put forward by the companies, are identified through competitions in the respective countries. Applications are assessed on the basis of clear and transparent criteria and in three separate steps - this, to assure an independent and transparent process. REACT also supports capacity development of enterprises in a variety of areas, brokering service for successful companies to access capital for scaling up, learning and advocacy on national and regional issues (laws, rules, licensing, trade barriers etc.).
The decision on the intervention covers five years and amounts to 400 000 000 SEK.

The main objective of the intervention Renewable Energy and Adaptation to Climate Technologies Sub-Saharan Africa (REACT SSA) is to support the private sector to meet the energy needs of rural communities in Africa, by stimulate small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to develop innovations in renewable energy that improve the lives of people living in poverty.
The outcomes of the intervention are: increased private sector investments in innovation within renewable energy in target countries, that positively impacts on poor households and environment. This will be achieved through four major outputs: - Business initiatives supported generate development benefits with high outreach, in particular to: those in rural areas; the very poor; women; youth - The business initiatives supported (and the products and services delivered), are sufficiently commercially viable that the associated development impacts are sustainable and that attract additional private investment. - Business initiatives supported address gender inequalities in the provision of renewable energy - AECF identifies, selects, contracts and provides managed support to viable, innovative business initiatives that deliver development impact.

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

tag.narrative: 7.1 - By 2030, ensure universal access to affordable, reliable and modern energy services.
7.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa allmän tillgång till ekonomiskt överkomliga, tillförlitliga och moderna energitjänster.

7.a - By 2030, enhance international cooperation to facilitate access to clean energy research and technology, including renewable energy, energy efficiency and advanced and cleaner fossil-fuel technology, and promote investment in energy infrastructure and clean energy technology.

7.a - Till 2030 stärka det internationella samarbetet för att underlätta tillgång till forskning och teknik inom ren energi, inklusive förnybar energi, energieffektivitet samt avancerad och renare fossilbränslebaserad teknik, samt främja investeringar i energiinfrastruktur och ren energiteknik.

title.narrative: AECF 2017-22 REnewable Energy and Adaptation to Climate Technologies-Agreement
AECF 2017-22 REnewable Energy and Adaptation to Climate Technologies

description.narrative:
REACT SSA is implemented in eight countries and includes a regional component. The results presented in this CoP are from the annual report for 2020. The results are presented on an aggregate level with some observations and comments below.
Some key results: 188,435 people with new or improved energy access against the annual target of 232,392 people (81%). Renewable Energy production/Climate impact 0.23MW of clean electricity capacity was installed against a target of 0.73 MW. Achievement is below target because high MW contributors (Mini grid projects) are yet to come online which will take place in 2021. 42,308t of CO2 emission avoided (against the planned figure of 41,344t), roughly 46% of these coming from clean cooking projects, and 20% of these coming from clean cooking and solar home system projects (tech-agnostic companies). Businesses co-invest US$6.25m as matching funds in 2020. The value was much higher than planned (US$ 1.66m). This was as a result of REACT SSA being over-conservative when estimating matching fund targets. Gender: Approximately 20% of companies funded are women led/owned. The target is 25 per cent will be women owned and/or managed. Out of the 1297 direct jobs created, 527, approximately 40 percent, were women. As contracting of companies started in 2020, some immediate results can now be seen, even though it's early to say what impact the programme will have.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
